reviewText:
What makes these films work is that they change the plot every time.  The first one was a classic exercise in paranoia and isolation.  The second one was more like an action film with lots of explosions and a small army of monsters.  The third one was about animal rights and learning how to coexist with dangerous species.  I admit I haven't seen the fourth movie or the TV series yet.

I loved how the third movie wasn't afraid to make fun of the first.  The minor characters got lots of names wrong and that made it more believeable that the main characters stopped maintaining their anti-graboid equipment.  It's amazing how quickly people get back to normal after a disaster; I do it myself a lot, too.  The names of the creatures are a lot of fun, except for 'Shrieker'.  That one doesn't fit with 'Graboid' and 'Ass-Blaster'.  Oh, well.  I do wish the government drones had been more fleshed out.  The last we heard from them they were trying to humbly ask Burt for help, and he just insulted them and stormed off.  Maybe if he'd been willing to talk to them things wouldn't have gotten out of hand.  I might be the only one to interpret that scene like that, though.
I liked this one... but don't waste your time with the next one or the failed TV episodes of Tremors. They wore me and the plot out..

i wouldn't say this film is bad, but it is not superb either. it is watchable for sure but you have to like the first tremors to ppreciate this one. there are consistencies from the first which help the film have value. the writers appeared to be exercising their creative imaginations evidently for this third chapter- they took several aspects from the first one & built up on that to make a continuation possible. perhaps when they were writing the original they predicted a sequel & purposely left things open for continuating interpretation. i thought including the endangered species aspect was constructive for the story, & makes sense that in reality it likely would be controversial given the hostility of the creature against humans. after all, those worms are rare & prehistoric so the animal rights twist seems a smart touchstone for the plot dynamics. i think this one would have been better as the sequel rather than tremors 2. the character Burt (michael gross)seems to have taken the stronghold, and he's certainly likable but i personally liked kevin bacon the best from the original movie, but Burt was the better choice over Fred Ward's character. they've had a tv series going for some time now, so those are interesting to watch too
A last resort for a snow day. Creatures look like they were made from Spore. Dialog and acting beyond cheesy. Watch something else.
My favorite movie series.  I love tremors, even if it is a bust!  Kevin Bacon should have went all three of them!
You simply must see Tremors 3 if you saw Tremors 2. And don't look at the silly review, the worst review the better in this case. Classic.

This movie lives up to the hype of the first 2 and takes it to a new level as the Graboids continue to evolve. It's action packed with the right balance of humor, action, and drama/horror that isn't over the top. Strongly recommend if you liked the first two Tremor movies.
Entertaining
Entertaining
Love this series!
I love all of the Tremor movies. This one did not disappoint!
cool
I liked it. It was entertaining.
Great movie
pretty good...
True fan
They'er always changing !!!
My kid's and I, could set and watch Tremors all day long!!

I love the whole series of Tremors movies. Can't say for sure what it is about them specifically...maybe it's my nostalgia from watching the first Tremors as a kid. But anytime I watch any of the movies from this series, I'm always put in a good mood, feeling perfectly comfortable just sitting on the couch and ready to watch the next one in the series again.
Big fan of the Tremors movies!!! This one doesn't disappoint!
Pure camp.  Loved every second of it...
It was ok not horrible or good but ok. You can tell it was low budget but not as low as the 4th one.
Kids and I loved it!
I like all of the tremors movies. This is no exception. Great movie
Love this movie!

Ever since the first movie I've been hooked. (with the exception of the fourth one ( what the hell were they thinking)) I even played "tremors" when I was a kid. "How do you play tremors?" you ask. Simple, just like the floor is lava.
Kids liked it.  I got them started on the first one.
I have the whole series. If you are a Sci Fi fan this series is great.

I'm a big fan of the "Tremors" series and tv show. If you are a fan of the show, and haven't watch this movie yet, it's a must watch. It explains a lot of the plot points from the tv show. If you are just a fan of the series, then this is still a enjoyable watch. Not a movie to watch on it's own, Go back and watch part 1 and 2 first to get the most out of this movie. It's not the best of the series, but still good enough to watch. More for a netflix view, but diehard fans a must own. This also the first time ever this movie has come out with a spanish language track. All of the other films have a spanish language track except for this one, until now.
Best in the series thus far. Fun to watch. Makes you jump a few times!
Oldy but goody
Love this movie!
Excellent background movie.
I have a 8 year old grandson who loves the Tremors series as much as his grandma! so when he spends the day with me we have a Tremors marathon! love it 10 Stars for us!!
Dumb movie, but good to keep kids entertained.
They really go down hill from here out.
I love this movie
Not as good as the first two but still fun watching.
Quite entertaining, but still not as good as the original.
Too funny and exciting!
Nothing beats the original, but this iteration of Tremors is still fun. Interesting to see so many of the original cast members.
Come on, what can you really say about this one
Fun film
A fun extension of the "Tremors" story.
dissapointed. just a rerun of original. loved T 1,2,3... this, not so much
